intro: Heterolaena nitida, commonly known as the slender flame tree, is a shrub or small tree native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its lance-shaped, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by small, round fruits. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodland or along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and parks.
